Metadata.Name: Medical/Mental Health Transfer Summary
Metadata.Summary: The Medical/Mental Health Transfer Summary IEPD was developed for the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project.
Metadata.Description: A Medical/Mental Health Transfer Summary details medical data about a subject. The data is sent from the jail to the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation reception center if a subject is transferred from local custody to the jurisdiction of the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation. The Medical/Mental Health Transfer Summary contains information pertaining to the subject, medications, and other medical history information. The Medical/Mental Health Transfer Summary is one of 44 IEPDs developed by the California Department of Justice - Data Exchange Project to support information exchange between state and local government organizations throughout the state of California. It could also be adapted for use in other states.
Metadata.Status: IEPD MMHTransSum complete and ready for implementation
Metadata.ExchangePartners: California state and local criminal justice agencies
Metadata.Process: When the jail transfers custody of a subject to the jurisdiction of the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation, the Medical/Mental Health Transfer Summary is sent to the reception center.
Metadata.Conditions: If a subject is transferred from local custody to the jurisdiction of the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation
Metadata.Sponsors: California Department of Justice and other California state and local criminal justice agencies - see master documentation
Metadata.Purpose: To inform the California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation of a transfer subject's medical/mental health summary.
